items.text: I've had to learn the hard way that poor planning leads to unnecessary stress and missed opportunities.
items.rationale: Learning from planning failures maps to time management but also touches on personal growth.

items.text: I carefully schedule my professional development activities alongside my regular work responsibilities.
items.rationale: Scheduling development activities could map to Time Management (scheduling skill) or Professional Growth (development prioritization).

items.text: I tend to interpret most situations in terms of how they will affect my career progress.
items.rationale: Directly captures the tendency to construe events through a work-oriented lens, a core feature of work-related personal constructs.

items.text: When I meet someone new, one of the first things I want to know is what they do for a living.
items.rationale: Reflects the cognitive habit of categorizing people primarily through occupational or professional constructs.

items.text: My sense of who I am is deeply tied to my professional role and accomplishments.
items.rationale: Identity construal organized around work roles is a hallmark of work-related personal constructs.

items.text: She evaluates her weekends based on how productive they were rather than how enjoyable.
items.rationale: Third-person observation showing that the productivity construct dominates even leisure time evaluation.

items.text: I find it difficult to relax unless I feel I've accomplished something meaningful at work that day.
items.rationale: Demonstrates that the work-achievement construct gates emotional states and self-permission to rest.

items.text: When I think about the future, my mind almost always goes to professional goals rather than personal ones.
items.rationale: Future-oriented cognition dominated by work constructs, showing the pervasiveness of this construct system.

items.text: He tends to describe people as either 'driven' or 'lazy' — there's not much in between for him.
items.rationale: Third-person description of a dichotomous construct pole organized around work ethic, reflecting constricted work-related construing.

items.text: I often feel that time spent not working is time wasted.
items.rationale: Reflects a construct system where value and meaning are primarily derived from work activity.

items.text: The way I judge whether a year has been good or bad is mostly based on my professional achievements.
items.rationale: Evaluative constructs for life satisfaction are anchored in work outcomes.

items.text: I naturally sort people into categories based on their competence and ambition at work.
items.rationale: Interpersonal construing organized around work-relevant dimensions like competence and ambition.

items.text: Even during vacations, I catch myself mentally planning work tasks or solving professional problems.
items.rationale: Demonstrates the permeability of work constructs into non-work contexts, a key indicator of work-related construing dominance.

items.text: When something goes wrong in my personal life, I cope by throwing myself into my work.
items.rationale: Work serves as the primary construct system for managing threat and anxiety, indicating its superordinate role in the construct hierarchy.

items.text: I sometimes struggle to connect with people who don't seem to take their careers seriously.
items.rationale: Suggests work-related construing shapes social relationships, but could also reflect interpersonal rigidity or values-based social filtering more broadly.

items.text: I feel most confident and like myself when I'm performing well in my job.
items.rationale: Self-worth tied to work performance is consistent with work-related construing, but could also reflect broader self-esteem contingency or need for external validation.

items.text: I like to have a detailed plan for every part of my day so nothing falls through the cracks.
items.rationale: While planning and organization can stem from work-related construing, this item could equally reflect a general need-for-structure or control-related construct system not specific to work.
